channel.title: Engadget
channel.description: Engadget is a web magazine with obsessive daily coverage of everything new in gadgets and consumer electronics
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2021 Yahoo! Inc. All rights reserved

item.title: Facebook is being sued in France for alleged 'deceptive' safety claims
item.description: Reporters Without Borders has sued Facebook for allegedly 'deceptive' claims of safety that let hate speech and misinformation proliferate.

item.title: Discovery+ is turning the GameStop-Reddit stock drama into a documentary
item.description: Discovery+ is making a documentary about the GameStop meme stock saga narrated by real-life wolf of Wall Street, Jordan Belfort.

item.title: Lenovo adds WiFi 6 and USB-C to its refreshed line of educational notebooks
item.description: All the PCs Lenovo announced today come in both Chrome OS and Windows variants.

item.title: Watch the OnePlus 9 launch event with us live at 9:40AM ET
item.description: OnePlus isn’t exactly known for keeping secrets — the company has spent the last few weeks teasing the launch of its new OnePlus 9 series smartphones, and a bevy of related leaks mean there’s little left to the imagination at this point. (Hello, OnePlus Watch!) I can think of one way to have some fun with the company’s latest streaming launch event, though: by watching it unfold with me and Engadget reviews editor Cherlynn Low.

item.title: Amazon's Kindle for Kids hits an all-time low of $75
item.description: If you missed Amazon's deal on Kindle for Kids back in February, don't worry: you can now get it from the website for only $75, which is the lowest price we've seen for the e-reader.

item.title: Master & Dynamic's MW08 earbuds combine premium materials and hybrid ANC
item.description: Master & Dynamic's latest true wireless earbuds are built with new materials, larger drivers and more robust active noise cancellation.

item.title: Porsche update gives the 2020 Taycan features from this year's model
item.description: Porsche has unveiled a free update for the 2020 Taycan that brings it up-to-date with features like improved driving dynamics, new intelligent charging functions and the latest navigation/infotainment features.

item.title: The Morning After: How new hard drives are using microwaves and lasers
item.description: How to stop your Android apps from crashing, and a look inside upcoming hard drive technology.

item.title: Microsoft's Xbox Network is a reaction to the free-to-play boom
item.description: Microsoft is using a new "Xbox Network" moniker for parts of its free online gaming service after recently enabling free multiplayer for free-to-play games like 'Fortnite.'

item.title: Google and Microsoft team up to fix compatibility issues between browsers
item.description: Google, Microsoft and the broader web community are working together to make it easier for developers to build websites that work seamlessly across browsers.

item.title: Regal Cinemas strikes Warner Bros. deal to show 2021 movies alongside HBO Max
item.description: Regal cinemas has announced that it will re-open US theaters on April 2nd with the release of Warner Bros.' Godzilla vs. Kong.

item.title: Nintendo's upgraded Switch may use NVIDIA DLSS for 4K gaming
item.description: Nintendo's next Switch may use an NVIDIA GPU that supports Deep Learning Super Sampling (DLSS) that will allow it to output higher-quality graphics.

item.title: Now everyone can send Steam Remote Play Together links
item.description: Steam's Remote Play Together is available to all users now that it's out of beta.

item.title: What's on TV this week: 'Dota: Dragon's Blood' and 'Invincible'
item.description: Netflix and Amazon are both launching new animated series this week: 'Dota: Dragon's Blood' and 'Invincible.'

item.title: Microsoft is reportedly 'in the running' to buy Discord for more than $10 billion
item.description: Discord is reportedly up for sale with a price that could go over $10 billion.

item.title: Nintendo and Niantic are teaming up again for an AR 'Pikmin' game
item.description: Remember Pokémon Go? Now Nintendo and Niantic are teaming up on a new Pikmin game.

item.title: Android apps like Gmail are crashing and 'WebView' is to blame
item.description: If Gmail and other Android apps on your phone are crashing -- you're not alone.

item.title: Disney+ calls 'Falcon and the Winter Soldier' its 'most watched' series premiere
item.description: According to Disney, its new MCU series debuted with the 'most watched' premiere ever on Disney+.

item.title: Jack Dorsey’s ‘first tweet' NFT sells for $2.9 million
item.description: Fifteen years after Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey sent the world’s first tweet, the message has sold for nearly $3 million as an NFT.

item.title: Netflix is adapting a Keanu Reeves comic into a live-action film and anime series
item.description: Netflix plans not one but two adaptations of BRZRKR.

item.title: A black-and-white version of 'Justice League' is heading to HBO Max
item.description: Zack Snyder isn't done with Justice League just yet.

item.title: President Biden will nominate antitrust scholar Lina Khan to the FTC
item.description: President Biden intends to nominate Columbia Law School professor Lina Khan to serve as a commissioner on the Federal Trade Commission.

item.title: Lego unveils a Space Shuttle Discovery and Hubble Telescope set
item.description: NASA worked with Lego on the 1:70 scale, 2,354-piece kit.

item.title: DoorDash now delivers COVID-19 testing kits
item.description: DoorDash is partnering with two digital health companies to allow people to order COVID-19 tests directly from its app.

item.title: Yup, Apple Arcade is still worth five bucks a month
item.description: My recent Apple Arcade binge made me realize it's still worth $5 a month.
